moves.1. e4: Queen sacrifice- my first I think. Cracking game where we both castled on opposite sides and tried to attack the other's king. Can you spot his brilliant trap on move 25 and if I say so myself, my nice move on #36 which allowed me to wrap it up. Pl comment freely, I am sure you will enjoy this high octane ride. Thanks also to tomoa who sent a nice message on defeat. PLEASE RATE
moves.2... Nc6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. e5: harass his knight, although it leaves this e pawn too much in front with no development of pieces. what do you think?
moves.7... Bg4 8. h3: dont like pins on my q
moves.8... Bxf3 9. Qxf3: now I think that exchange of an active bishop for a Knight is meaningless?!
moves.10... dxe5: there goes my presence in the center
moves.12... a6 13. Qd2: plan 0-0-0 quickly as my kingside is looking exposed
moves.14... Nde6 15. Be2: ignore exchange of b/knight as I want to develop and take my lsb to f3
moves.15... Qd4: well e5 pawn is lost, could I have done better?
now why did he let me take this b7 pawn, was it to open up the b file for an attack on my king?
moves.20... Nf4 21. Be4 Nce6 22. Nd5: love my knight sitting on this forward perch
moves.23... f5: now this was his biggest mistake for in the ensuing exchange he opens up the g file. watch
moves.25... Rb8: suddenly he attacks and sets up a brilliant trap. CAN YOU SPOT MY NEXT MOVE
moves.26. Kb1: yes, if my king was still sitting on c1, then 26...Nxd3 would have been curtains for me. normally I do not spot such traps for I am the king of doziness often playing chess in one window and watching you tube on another
moves.26... Kh8: now he gets his K off the open g file
moves.27. Rhe1: no plan right now, just harass his Q
moves.27... Qd6 28. Ref1: eye his f5 pawn in the future
moves.28... Nxd5 29. Bxd5 Nd4: so much so for eyeing his f5 pawn
moves.30. Rfg1: control open file, game has stalled somewhat
moves.30... e6 31. Bh1: need to make sure he does not put rook or q on b7. but my q is quite passive here
moves.31... Qc7 32. Qg5: now I attack, f6 would be a good square for my q
moves.34. Be4: never mind, I can now attack h7
moves.34... f3: do not like this at all, not going according to my script
moves.35. Ref1 Qh2: what the bloody hell!! should I bring my q back to c1, but then his knight will go e2- disaster. should I go b3 but then Nxb3, ax N, Rx b3  and I may as well go minesweeping in Bosnia. Spend 15 mins analysing. Can you spot a BRILLIANT move that I can play??
moves.36. Rf2: he takes f2 and my q checks him at e5
moves.37... Rbf8 38. Qh5 Qd6: should he have brought his q to g3?
moves.39... a5 40. Bxf3 Rf7f5: CAN YOU SPOT WHAT I PLAY NEXT?? learnt in the 'Idiot's guide to chess' - a real book actually- that one should always defend by attacking
moves.41. Be4: queen sacrifice, my first, I think
moves.42... Kg7: he should have retaken with his q for I go--
moves.43. Rf1f7+: he resigns. pl comment freely. hope you enjoyed. game swung perilously at times, we started and finished on same day. thanks to tomoa, he sent a gracious message in defeat. PLEASE RATE
